text: Dane Šijan (; born 5 February 1977) is a Serbian former handball player. ==Career== Over the course of his career that spanned more than two decades, Šijan played for Metaloplastika, Proleter Zrenjanin, Rudar Kostolac, Partizan (2001–2003), IF Guif (2003–2005), Viborg (2005–2007 and 2008–2012), SG Flensburg-Handewitt (2007–2008), Bjerringbro-Silkeborg (2012–2014), Mors-Thy (2014–2016) and Dobrogea Sud Constanța (2016–2018). At international level, Šijan represented Serbia and Montenegro at the 2004 European Men's Handball Championship. He was later capped for Serbia. ==Honours== ;Partizan * Handball League of Serbia and Montenegro: 2001–02, 2002–03 ;Dobrogea Sud Constanța * Cupa României: 2017–18 * Supercupa României: 2017 ==References== ==External links== * EHF record Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Šabac Category:Serbian male handball players Category:RK Metaloplastika players Category:RK Partizan players Category:SG Flensburg-Handewitt players Category:Handball-Bundesliga players Category:Expatriate handball players Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Sweden Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Denmark Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Germany Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Romania
title: Dane Šijan
